name: Frédéric Labrosse
content: Staff profiles  :		Department of Computer Science ,		Aberystwyth UniversityDr Fred Labrosse PhD (École Polytechnique de Montréal, Canada) Senior Lecturer Department of Computer Science Contact Details Email: ffl@aber.ac.uk ORCID: 0000-0001-6189-1036 Office: 1.11, Physical Sciences Building Phone: +44 (0) 1970 622388 Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.co.uk/citations?user=IhQfEEwAAAAJ Research Portal Profile Profile Dr Labrosse obtained his PhD in Electrical Engineering from the École Polytechnique de Montréal, Canada, in 1999.  After a postdoc in the then Mathematics department, Computing group, University of Bath, UK, he joined the Computer Science department, Aberystwyth University, Wales, UK, in 2000. Teaching Module Coordinator CSS0560 - Integrated year studying abroad CSS0660 - Integrated year studying abroad Lecturer PGM1610 - Public Engagement and Impact CS39440 - Major Project CS31920 - Advanced Algorithms CS26020 - Robotics and Embedded Systems CSS0760 - Sandwich Year Coordinator CSS0560 - Integrated year studying abroad CSS0660 - Integrated year studying abroad Moderator CS23820 - C and C++ Tutor CC39440 - Prosiect Hir Dr Labrosse teaches in the various robotics modules offered by the department of Computer Science. Research Dr Labrosse's research interests focus on robotics and image processing/machine vision for robotics, specifically in the area of autonomous, off-road, navigation.  This includes autonomous driving on ill-defined "roads", cross-field navigation and topological mapping and planning.  Dr Labrosse collaborates with a variety of "customers" having real problems to solve in the real world.  This includes archaeologists, biologists and geographers.  For these applications, Dr Labrosse uses a variety of robots ranging from large wheeled robots to multi-copters and fixed wing air frames.  Many of these robots have been designed and built in the Computer Science department for specific applications and general research.
